attributes.comment:
It has been brought to our attention that USCIS has a proposal to raise some of
their fees.

The proposed changes include:
1.) Biometrics (fingerprints) from $70 to $80 per person, and
2.) the I-600A from $545 to $670.

We are currently waiting to adopt our child, but both our fingerprints and I-600A
will probably expire before we receive our child. We don't understand why we
would have to re-submit our fingerprints and the I-600A when none of our
information has changed. Not only will we have to renew our fingerprints and I-
600A, but now you are proposing to increase it as well? Please don't do this to
us! We cannot afford to pay anymore money and we beg you not to increase
these fees.
Thank you for hearing us out.
Andrea Mercado & Paul Lentz, soon to be adoptive parents for the first time and
hopefully save a child's life!
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Andrea Mercado
